VegDescription: The modern swamp is sedge-sphagnum, meso-eutrophic. In the cover - sphagnum  and green mosses, sedges, shrubs, in the stands - rarely pine and birch. In the surrounding of the lake are pine forests
Publication1: Panova N. To., Korotkovskaya T. G. Palynological study of the peat bog near lake. Sandy / / forest-Ecological and palynological studies of swamps in the Middle Urals. Sverdlovsk, 1990. P. 47-55.
Worker1_Address1: Botanical garden of the Ural division of the Russian Academy of sciences. Sverdlovsk region, Yecaterinburg, 8 Marta str., 202A. 620130

VegDescription: The swamp is mesotrophic, with a forest stand of pine and birch, in the willow undergrowth. Herbaceous cover: wild rosemary, marsh cinquefoil (Comarum palustre L.), grasses (Calamagrostis langsdorfii (Link.) Trin., Phragmites), marsh horsetail (Equisetum palustre L.), sedges, sphagnum mosses. On the bumps near the trees grows cranberries (Oxycoccus palustris Pers.
Publication1: Panova N. To., Antipina T. G. To the dynamics of the natural environment in the upper reaches of the Iset river in the iron age/ Fifth Berzowska read to the 100th anniversary of E. M. bers, "Square", Ekaterinburg, 2006. C. 209-211.
Worker1_Address1: Botanical garden of the Ural division of the Russian Academy of sciences. Sverdlovsk region, Yecaterinburg, 8 Marta str., 202A. 620130
